00023 #ifndef __TLM_QUANTUMKEEPER_H__
00024 #define __TLM_QUANTUMKEEPER_H__
00025 
00026 #include "tlm_core/tlm_2/tlm_quantum/tlm_global_quantum.h"
00027 
00028 namespace tlm_utils {
00029 
00030   //
00031   // tlm_quantumkeeper class
00032   //
00033   // The tlm_quantumkeeper class is used to keep track of the local time in
00034   // an initiator (how much it has run ahead of the SystemC time), to
00035   // synchronize with SystemC time etc.
00036   //
00037   class tlm_quantumkeeper
00038   {
00039   public:
00040     //
00041     // Static setters/getters for the global quantum value.
00042     //
00043     // The global quantum is the maximum time an initiator can run ahead of
00044     // systemC time. All initiators will synchronize on timingpoints that are
00045     // multiples of the global quantum value.
00046     //
00047     static void set_global_quantum(const sc_core::sc_time& t)
00048     {
00049       tlm::tlm_global_quantum::instance().set(t);
00050     }
00051 
00052     static const sc_core::sc_time& get_global_quantum()
00053     {
00054       return tlm::tlm_global_quantum::instance().get();
00055     }
00056 
00057   public:
00058     tlm_quantumkeeper() :
00059       m_next_sync_point(sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME),
00060       m_local_time(sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME)
00061     {
00062     }
00063 
00064     virtual ~tlm_quantumkeeper() {}
00065 
00066     //
00067     // Increment the local time (the time the initiator is ahead of the
00068     // systemC time) After incrementing the local time an initiator should
00069     // check (with the need_sync method) if a sync is required.
00070     //
00071     virtual void inc(const sc_core::sc_time& t)
00072     {
00073       m_local_time += t;
00074     }
00075 
00076     //
00077     // Sets the local time (the time the initiator is ahead of the
00078     // systemC time) After changing the local time an initiator should
00079     // check (with the need_sync method) if a sync is required.
00080     //
00081     virtual void set(const sc_core::sc_time& t)
00082     {
00083       m_local_time = t;
00084     }
00085 
00086     //
00087     // Checks if a sync to systemC is required for this initiator. This will
00088     // be the case if the local time becomes greater than the local (current)
00089     // quantum value for this initiator.
00090     //
00091     virtual bool need_sync() const
00092     {
00093       return sc_core::sc_time_stamp() + m_local_time >= m_next_sync_point;
00094     }
00095 
00096     //
00097     // Synchronize to systemC. This call will do a wait for the time the
00098     // initiator was running ahead of systemC time and reset the
00099     // tlm_quantumkeeper.
00100     //
00101     virtual void sync()
00102     {
00103       sc_core::wait(m_local_time);
00104       reset();
00105     }
00106 
00107     //
00108     // Non-virtual convenience method to set the local time and sync only if needed
00109     //
00110     void set_and_sync(const sc_core::sc_time& t)
00111     {
00112       set(t);
00113       if (need_sync())
00114         sync();
00115     }
00116 
00117     //
00118     // Resets the local time to SC_ZERO_TIME and computes the value of the
00119     // next local quantum. This method should be called by an initiator after
00120     // a wait because of a synchronization request by a target (TLM_ACCEPTED,
00121     // or TLM_UPDATED).
00122     //
00123     virtual void reset()
00124     {
00125       m_local_time = sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME;
00126       m_next_sync_point = sc_core::sc_time_stamp() + compute_local_quantum();
00127     }
00128 
00129     //
00130     // Helper function to get the current systemC time, taken the local time
00131     // into account. The current systemC time is calculated as the time
00132     // returned by sc_time_stamp incremeneted with the time the initiator is
00133     // running ahead.
00134     //
00135     virtual sc_core::sc_time get_current_time() const
00136     {
00137       return sc_core::sc_time_stamp() + m_local_time;
00138     }
00139 
00140     //
00141     // Helper functions to get the time the initiator is running ahead of
00142     // systenC (local time). This time should be passed to a target in the
00143     // nb_transport call
00144     //
00145     virtual sc_core::sc_time get_local_time() const
00146     {
00147       return m_local_time;
00148     }
00149 
00150   protected:
00151     //
00152     // Calculate the next local quantum for this initiator.
00153     //
00154     // The method can be overloaded in a derived object if an initiator wants
00155     // to use another local quantum. This derived object should also take the
00156     // global quantum into account. It's local quantum should not be set to a
00157     // value that is larger than the quantum returned by the
00158     // compute_local_quantum of the tlm_global_quantum singleton.
00159     //
00160     virtual sc_core::sc_time compute_local_quantum()
00161     {
00162       return tlm::tlm_global_quantum::instance().compute_local_quantum();
00163     }
00164 
00165   protected:
00166     sc_core::sc_time m_next_sync_point;
00167     sc_core::sc_time m_local_time;
00168   };
00169 
00170 } // namespace tlm
00171 
00172 #endif
